mmwave_internal.h File Reference

This is the internal Header for the mmWave module. This header file should NOT be directly included by applications. More...

#include <ti/common/mmwave_error.h>
#include <ti/drivers/crc/crc.h>
#include <ti/drivers/osal/SemaphoreP.h>
#include <ti/drivers/mailbox/mailbox.h>
#include <ti/control/mmwave/include/mmwave_listlib.h>

Macros

#define MMWAVE_MAX_NUM_SPAWN_LIST   4U
 This defines the maximum number of entries in the spawn list.
 
#define MMWAVE_STATUS_OPENED   1U
 Status flag to indicate the open state.
 
#define MMWAVE_STATUS_CONFIGURED   2U
 Status flag to indicate the configured state.
 
#define MMWAVE_STATUS_SYNCHRONIZED   4U
 Status flag to indicate the synchronization state.
 
#define MMWAVE_STATUS_STARTED   8U
 Status flag to indicate the started state.
 
#define MMWAVE_RF_INITIALIZED   1U
 Link Status flag used to indicate that the RF was initialized successfully.
 
#define MMWAVE_RF_INIT_FAILED   2U
 Link Status flag used to indicate that the RF initialization failed.
 
#define MMWAVE_RF_CALIBRATION_DONE   4U
 Link Status flag used to indicate that the RF Calibration completed.
 
#define MMWAVE_RF_CALIBRATION_FAILED   8U
 Link Status flag used to indicate that the Calibration failed.
 
#define MMWAVE_RF_ESM_FAULT   16U
 Link Status flag used to indicate that the ESM fault was detected.
 
#define MMWAVE_RF_CPU_FAULT   32U
 Link Status flag used to indicate that the CPU fault was detected.
 
#define MMWAVE_RF_ANALOG_FAULT   64U
 Link Status flag used to indicate that the Analog fault was detected.

Variables

MMWave_MCB gMMWave_MCB
 This the global variable which track all the information which is required by the mmWave control module.
 

Detailed Description

This is the internal Header for the mmWave module. This header file should NOT be directly included by applications.

Function Documentation

MMWave_ErrorLevel MMWave_decodeErrorLevel ( int32_t  errCode)

Description
This is a utility function which given the error code will return the corresponding error level.

Parameters
[in]errCodeEncoded error code retreived from the mmWave API. This is the error code which will be decoded.
Return values
DecodedError Level
int32_t MMWave_deviceCfgAsyncEvent ( const MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to configure the asynchronous events. On Dual core either the DSS or the MSS could be configured to be the recepient of asynchronous events. It also configures if the start/stop asynchronous events are enabled or disabled.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave control block
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

Description
The function is used to configure the asynchronous events. On the Single Core the MSS is the default handler for all asynchronous events and this is the default behavior for the BSS. We only need to configure if the start/stop asynchronous events are enabled or disabled.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave control block
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t MMWave_deviceCfgFxn ( const MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
MMWave_CtrlCfg *  ptrControlCfg,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to handle the configuration for Dual core.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave MCB
[in]ptrControlCfgPointer to the mmWave control configuration
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

Description
The function is used to handle the configuration for the Single Core. There is only the MSS executing in the system here so we dont need to have any additional handling of the configuration.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave MCB
[in]ptrControlCfgPointer to the mmWave control configuration
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Alwayssuccess

void MMWave_deviceEventFxn ( const MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
uint16_t  msgId,
uint16_t  sbId,
uint16_t  sbLen,
uint8_t *  payload 
)

Description
The function is used to handle the link asynchronous events for Dual core. On Dual core implementation the mmWave module is responsible for relaying the mmWave link events to the peer execution domain

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave control block
[in]msgIdMessage Identifier
[in]sbIdSubblock identifier
[in]sbLenLength of the subblock
[in]payloadPointer to the payload buffer
Return values
Notapplicable

Description
The function is used to handle the link asynchronous events for the Single Core. There is only the MSS executing in the system here so we dont need to have any additional handling.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave control block
[in]msgIdMessage Identifier
[in]sbIdSubblock identifier
[in]sbLenLength of the subblock
[in]payloadPointer to the payload buffer
Return values
Notapplicable
int32_t MMWave_deviceExecuteFxn ( MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to handle the SOC specific execution. On Dual core we check if there are any messages which have been received from the peer execution domain and process these messages.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

Description
The function is used to execute the Single Core SOC specific execution for mmWave. There is nothing to be done here.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success
void MMWave_deviceGetDeviceInfo ( const MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
rlUInt8_t *  devType,
rlUInt8_t *  platform 
)

Description
The function is used to get the mmWave link device information. On Dual core the link could execute on either the DSS or MSS. The function is used to handle these scenarios

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave control block
[out]devTypeDevice Type populated by the API
[out]platformPlatform populated by the API
Return values
Notapplicable

Description
The function is used to get the mmWave link device information. On the Single Core the link always executes only on the MSS.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave control block
[out]devTypeDevice Type populated by the API
[out]platformPlatform populated by the API
Return values
DeviceType as specified by the mmWave Link

int32_t MMWave_deviceStartFxn ( const MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to handle the link start for Dual core.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

Description
The function is used to handle the link start for the Single Core. There is only the MSS executing in the system here so nothing additional needs to be done here.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Alwayssuccess

int32_t MMWave_deviceSyncFxn ( const MMWave_MCB *  ptrMMWaveMCB,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to synchronize mmWave on Dual Core. The function checks the status of the mmWave between the peers.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
Synchronized- 1
Unsynchronized- 0
Error- <0

Description
The function is used to synchronize mmWave on Single Core. Since only the MSS executes on the system the module is always synchronized.

Parameters
[in]ptrMMWaveMCBPointer to the mmWave MCB
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API on an error
Return values
1- Always synchronized
int32_t MMWave_encodeError ( MMWave_ErrorLevel  errorLevel,
int32_t  mmWaveError,
int32_t  subSysError 
)

Description
The function is used to encode the error code. This encoded error will be returned back to the application.

Parameters
[in]errorLevelError level to be encoded
[in]mmWaveErrorError code for the mmWave
[in]subSysErrorSubsystem error code
Return values
Encodederror code
